text: Patricia Lea "Patty" Jenkins (born July 24, 1971) is an American movie director and screenwriter. She directed Monster (2003), Wonder Woman (2017) ,and Wonder Woman 1984 (2019). In 2011, Jenkins received an Emmy nomination for Outstanding Directing for a Drama Series for the pilot of The Killing. ==Early life== Jenkins was born July 24, 1971 at an air force base in Victorville, California."Patty Jenkins". Moviefone. Retrieved June 5, 2017. Her father was William T. Jenkins, an Air Force captain and fighter pilot who earned a Silver Star in the Vietnam War. Her mother was Emily Roth, who worked in San Francisco as an environmental scientist. She has an older sister, Elaine Roth. She lived in Lawrence, Kansas from when she was in kindergarten through her junior year of high school. ==Personal life== In 2007, Jenkins married Sam Sheridan. Sheridan is a former firefighter, and he is the author of the book A Fighter's Heart. Jenkins and Sheridan have a son. They live in Santa Monica, California. ==Filmography== ===Film=== Year Title Director Writer Producer Notes 1996 A Modern Affair Second Assistant Camera 2001 Velocity Rules Short film 2003 Monster 2017 Wonder Woman 2020 Wonder Woman 1984 Post-production 2023 Star Wars: Rogue Squadron ===Television=== Year Title Director Executive Producer Actress Notes 2004 Arrested Development Episode: "The One Where They Build a House" 2006 Entourage Episodes: "Crash and Burn" and "The Release" 2008 The Sarah Silverman Program Role: Jill Talley; Episode: "Fetus Don't Fail Me Now" 2011 Five Television film; segment: "Pearl" 2011â€“2012 The Killing Episodes: "Pilot" and "What I Know" 2013 Betrayal Episode: "Pilot" 2015 Exposed Unaired pilot 2019 I Am the Night Episodes: "Pilot" and "Phenomenon of Interference" ==Awards and nominations== Year Award Category Nominee Result 2001 Telluride Indiefest Short Film Winner Velocity Rules 2004 American Film Institute Franklin J.
